title: India-US trade deal: Some key questions that still remain unanswered
content: India-US trade deal: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal’s press conference on Tuesday also offered little details, though he was clear that sensitive sectors of agriculture and dairy will continue to be protected.

title: From tariffs to tailfins: India to scale up US arms and aircraft purchases
content: India has agreed to significantly increase purchases of US petroleum, defense systems, and commercial aircraft, totaling up to $500 billion. This trade deal aims to slash tariffs and deepen economic alignment, particularly in strategic sectors like aviation and defense, reshaping bilateral ties for years to come.

title: Controversy in Pakistan! Umpire under fire for Connolly dismissal - Watch
content: Australia’s 3-0 T20 series loss to Pakistan sparked controversy after replays showed Cooper Connolly was wrongly stumped in the third match. Wicketkeeper Khawaja Nafay broke the stumps with the glove not holding the ball, breaching ICC rules. The error went unchecked, angering fans and raising concerns over umpiring and sportsmanship despite Pakistan’s dominant win.

title: Amazon layoffs: What WARN filing in Amazon's 'home state' says on roles cut and more
content: Amazon is laying off 2,198 employees in Washington, primarily impacting software development, engineering management, and product roles. These cuts are part of a broader company-wide reduction affecting 16,000 corporate employees globally. The separations, scheduled to begin April 28, 2026, aim to "reduce layers, increase ownership, and remove bureaucracy."

title: Why Union Budget 2026 avoided populism and chose stability
content: If the past Union Budgets were shaped by tax reforms and progressive personal tax restructuring, then Budget 2026 is more about firefighting and shielding the economy from global shocks, managing uncertainty and rebuilding confidence amid a volatile international environment.

title: From H'wood to hard reality: How a modern 'Fire Sale' would actually work; can India survive it?
content: Once a Hollywood fantasy, a nation's digital paralysis is now a real threat.  Modern states, deeply interconnected, face coordinated cyber, electronic warfare, and information attacks.  This "Fire Sale" concept, unfolding in phases, targets power, communications, and finance, aiming to destabilize before conflict erupts, posing a significant challenge for digitally dependent nations like India.

title: Oracle makes a public clarification on the deal that could end up in 30,000 job cuts
content: Oracle is defending its substantial AI partnership with OpenAI amidst reports of potential job cuts to fund infrastructure. Despite a stalled Nvidia deal, Oracle remains confident in OpenAI's funding capabilities. However, the company's massive debt and market cap decline raise investor concerns about its ambitious AI spending plans.

title: India–US trade deal: New Delhi may scale back Russian oil buys after tariff relief
content: India will significantly reduce crude oil imports from Russia, adhering to a US-brokered trade deal that lowers tariffs on Indian goods. While existing contracts will be honored, new orders for Russian crude will cease, except for Nayara Energy due to its unique circumstances. This move aims to boost Indian exports and diversify energy sources.

title: Inside China's grey zone activities: How Beijing is salami slicing its way to influence
content: China is employing a 'salami slicing' strategy, taking incremental steps across military, economic, and technological domains to alter realities without triggering conflict. This 'gray zone' approach, evident in the South China Sea and beyond, bypasses international law and exploits rivals' hesitation. The cumulative effect creates new facts on the ground, challenging the existing order.

title: Gautam's gambit! India has a tailor-made team to win back-to-back T20 World Cups
content: In Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakravarthy, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel, India arguably have the best quartet of bowlers at the T20 World Cup. Not to forget, Kuldeep Yadav might have to wait for his chances and the vastly improved Shivam Dube is no pushover. The Suryakumar Yadav-led team looks dangerous not just on paper but has also walked the talk on the field.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff makes fun of Microsoft Copilot again
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has sharply criticized Microsoft's Copilot, dubbing it 'Clippy 2.0' and deeming it disappointing and inaccurate. He champions Salesforce's own Slackbot, powered by Anthropic's Claude, as a superior AI CRM sidekick. This move signifies Salesforce's strong push into its AI agent ecosystem, contrasting with Benioff's previous praise for Google's Gemini 3.0.

title: 'India got best deal': Goyal hails trade pact with US; credits PM for protecting farm, dairy sectors
content: Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday described the India–US trade agreement as a “tremendous opportunity” for the country, calling it the best deal India has secured compared to its neighbours. Addressing a press conference he said that the pact sends positive signals for the future and will benefit all citizens.

title: SIR showdown: TMC mulls impeachment motion against CEC; Mamata challenges Centre
content: Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee announced plans to move an impeachment motion against the Chief Election Commissioner over the Special Intensive Revision process. The party alleges the SIR is flawed and aims to disenfranchise citizens, particularly in opposition-ruled states ahead of elections. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee also criticized the timing and selective application of the SIR.

title: Bhambri scripts history, becomes first Indian after Bopanna to obtain this rare feat
content: Yuki Bhambri climbed to a career-high world No. 20 in the ATP doubles rankings, becoming the first Indian since Rohan Bopanna to enter the Top 20. The rise follows strong performances, including a solid Australian Open run, a US Open semifinal in 2025, and his maiden ATP 500 title in Dubai.

title: Ann Michael starts Super Bowl week strong with bold workout and confident message
content: Ann Michael Maye kicked off Super Bowl 2026 week with a viral workout post as the Patriots prepare to face the Seahawks. From supporting Drake Maye at key playoff moments to launching her NBC Sports Boston show, Ann’s rise mirrors New England’s return to the sport’s biggest stage.

title: Tom Brady stays neutral for Super Bowl LX: 'I have no dog in the fight'
content: Tom Brady says he won’t root for the New England Patriots or the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, telling Jim Gray on the ‘Let’s Go!’ podcast he has “no dog in the fight” and just wants good football. We break down why the Raiders minority owner is staying neutral and how fans are reacting to his surprising stance today.

title: Dodgers target $400M Cy Young deal with Tigers; Sasaki a key trade piece
content: A potential trade between the Los Angeles Dodgers and Detroit Tigers involves Roki Sasaki for Tarik Skubal. This hypothetical deal highlights the Dodgers' focus on immediate championship contention and the Tigers' long-term roster development. The exchange would significantly alter both pitching staffs, with the Dodgers gaining a proven starter and the Tigers acquiring a young arm with future control.

title: US-Iran tensions: Tehran signals readiness for talks amid Trump's pressure
content: Iran's President Pezeshkian has ordered talks with the US, seeking an environment free from threats and unreasonable expectations, focusing on national interests. This comes amid heightened regional tensions and a warning from President Trump about potential "bad things."  Tehran insists negotiations must center on the nuclear issue, not defense capabilities.

title: Delhi horror: 36-year-old businessman dies days after being hit with helmet by delivery agents
content: A 36-year-old businessman, Shivam Gupta, tragically passed away after a brutal assault by food delivery agents in Delhi. The incident, stemming from a verbal dispute over water, escalated into a violent attack involving punches, kicks, and a helmet.  Shivam's family is devastated, demanding swift justice for the senseless loss of their only child.

title: 'Blot on democracy': Rahul writes to LS Speaker; says 'prevented' from speaking in House
content: Rahul Gandhi has lodged a strong protest with Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, citing his inability to speak on the President's address.  Gandhi claims he was prevented from quoting an unpublished book by former Army Chief General MM Naravane on the India-China clashes, calling it a "blot on our democracy" and a deliberate government attempt to silence him.

title: Rashmika Mandanna reacts to February 26 wedding buzz with Vijay Deverakonda
content: Wedding rumours around Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna have once again gathered momentum, with the couple now said to be tying the knot later this month in Udaipur. While both actors have maintained silence despite reports of a private engagement in October 2025, Rashmika appeared to all but confirm the February 26 wedding date during a recent interaction with a paparazzo.

title: Watch: Boxer loses wig during fight, blames mother's shampoo
content: American boxer Jarrell Miller won his heavyweight bout at Madison Square Garden but lost his toupee mid-fight after taking punches from Kingsley Ibeh. Spotting it come loose, he laughed and threw it into the crowd, then blamed his sudden hair loss on shampoo at his mother’s house, calling the moment embarrassing but funny.

title: After 1 yr of prez rule, Manipur to get new CM - who is Yumnam Singh
content: Bharatiya Janata Party's Yumnam Khemchand has been elected as the leader of the legislative party and is set to become the new chief minister of Manipur. This development follows a meeting of BJP legislative members in Delhi. Khemchand, a senior leader, previously served as the assembly speaker and a cabinet minister.

title: Delhi High Court orders Rajpal Yadav to surrender in Rs 9 crore cheque bounce cases
content: Delhi High Court has ordered actor Rajpal Yadav to surrender by February 4 after he failed to pay Rs 9 crore in cheque bounce cases. Despite repeated assurances and admitting liability, Yadav has not complied with court directives. The court criticized his repeated breaches of undertakings, leading to the surrender order to serve his sentence.

title: T20 World Cup: 'India vs Pakistan presented as war now,' says J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: Omar Abdullah, the Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir, expressed disappointment over Pakistan's decision to withdraw from the T20 World Cup match against India, underscoring the troubling overlap of sports and politics. He pointed out that the hype surrounding India-Pakistan games often leads to unnecessary disputes.

title: Man drowns daughter to stay eligible for poll; how WhatsApp pic exposed the crime
content: A father aspiring to contest Maharashtra panchayat elections, ineligible due to the two-child norm, allegedly drowned his six-year-old twin daughter in a Telangana canal. The accused, Pandurang Kondamangale, confessed after his daughter's body was found. The outgoing sarpanch, who encouraged him, was also arrested for aiding the plot.

title: Unsold in IPL, Australia great joins PSL team for debut campaign
content: Former Australia captain Steve Smith has signed with PSL newcomers Sialkot Stallionz for the 2026 season, marking his first appearance in the league. Signed directly under league rules, Smith is expected to play a key leadership role. Despite going unsold in the IPL, he remains a top T20 performer after impressing in the Big Bash League.

title: Skoda Kylaq hits 50,000 sales: What made it the brand's long-awaited success in India
content: To sustain its growth over the longer term in a highly competitive compact SUV market, the Skoda Kylaq will need periodic design and interior updates, meaningful feature additions that keep pace with segment expectations. The Kylaq’s biggest limitation is its single 1.0-litre, three-cylinder turbo-petrol engine, which can feel a bit strained when pushed hard, especially against four-cylinder rivals.

title: Now representing USA, Ranjane looking to play against ‘best buddy’ SKY
content: Former Mumbai allrounder Shubham Ranjane, now representing USA, is reliving nostalgic moments after returning to Mumbai for the T20 World Cup. Excited to play at Wankhede, meet close friend Suryakumar Yadav, and face India, Ranjane calls it a proud, emotional homecoming as family cheers him on.

title: 'It is about tariff reduction': FM Sitharaman on India-US trade deal
content: India and the US have finalized a trade deal, reducing US tariffs on Indian goods from 25% to 18%. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman confirmed the tariff reduction, calling it "very good news." President Trump announced the agreement, highlighting increased "BUY AMERICAN" commitments from India and over $500 billion in US product purchases.

title: 'Take immediate action’: MEA condemns theft of Mahatma Gandhi statue in Australia
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly condemned the theft of Mahatma Gandhi's bronze statue from the Australian Indian Community Centre in Melbourne. The ministry has urged Australian authorities to take immediate action to recover the statue and hold the perpetrators accountable for the act.

title: Pressure mounts on Patrick Mahomes as Chiefs prepare for roster changes
content: The Kansas City Chiefs enter a difficult offseason as injuries, expiring contracts, and salary cap limits collide. Patrick Mahomes remains the focus, but Travis Kelce’s future and rising player costs complicate decisions. With many players nearing free agency, Kansas City must carefully balance loyalty, money, and long-term stability heading toward the 2026 season.

title: 'Our Prime Minister compromised, sold our nation': Rahul Gandhi outside Parliament after LS snub
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of being "compromised" and "selling out" India's progress in a recent trade deal with the US, claiming it was signed under "immense pressure.

title: Stefon Diggs sparks Super Bowl buzz, says Cardi B proposal is 'on the agenda'
content: As Stefon Diggs gets ready for the Super Bowl, attention has shifted beyond football to his relationship with Cardi B. The couple, who have been together for over a year and share a baby boy, have faced questions about what comes next. Asked about a possible proposal, Diggs brushed it off, saying he needs to “get mine first” before thinking about a ring.

title: GSI to probe land subsidence in Godavari delta in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Water Resource Department has roped in the experts to fix the scientific reasons for the land subsidence, factors for the defunct 350-long irrigation drains in the Central Delta thriving with oil and natural gas exploration activities.

title: Government signs MoU to establish Bharat Container Shipping Line
content: The Bharat Container Shipping Line will anchor India’s container trade in Indian hands and strengthen our strategic and commercial presence in global maritime trade, the minister said

title: Economic empowerment of women key to self-reliance: Minister
content: Kerala State Women’s Development Corporation’s Escalera 2026, a women’s fest, begins at Kanakakkunnu

title: Kerala being punished for not accepting BJP: Pinarayi
content: Congress is acting like BJP’s B-team and is remaining silent even as the Union govt. is financially choking the State, says Chief Minister

title: UDF finalising candidate list for Kottayam ahead of Statewide rally
content: The UDF aims to finalise candidates, aligning with Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan’s rally on February 24. Amid ongoing seat-sharing disputes, particularly in Changanassery and Ettumanur, UDF leaders are prioritising candidates with community support to reclaim lost seats.

title: India-U.S. deal does not compromise sensitive agricultural, dairy sectors, details soon: Goyal
content: The Commerce and Industry Minister says the deal would benefit all of India’s labour-intensive exporting sectors; blames Opposition for not making statement in Parliament; joint India-U.S. note awaited

title: Ex-corporators threaten agitation if e‑Khata software glitches aren’t fixed within a week
content: The former mayer points out that technical glitches have repeatedly marred the e-Khata system ever since it was introduced over six months ago

title: SFI leaders ‘abducted’ in Tirupati
content: The leaders were on their way to the Collectorate to join the protest against alleged irregularities of Mohan Babu University, when nearly 30 persons reportedly attacked SFI district general secretary S. Akbar and the federation’s SVU students’ union leader Vinod

title: West Bengal BJP admits harassment of voters during SIR; blames poll officials, TMC
content: BJP MLAs submit memo to Governor claiming a section of EROS, AEROs, BLOs are making “deliberate” mistakes during SIR, issuing notices to harass people, in collusion with Trinamool Congress and I-PAC

title: Don’t issue work order for ECR elevated corridor, orders Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan pass the interim order on a writ appeal filed by a disqualified bidder

title: Markapuram district to get Collectorate building soon
content: District administration is planning to convert a school building into Collector office at Goguladinne village in Markapuram mandal

title: Another Indian! After Pragg, Norway Chess 2026 reveals 4th participant
content: Reigning world champion Gukesh Dommaraju has been confirmed as the fourth participant for Norway Chess 2026, joining fellow Indian R Praggnanandhaa. The youngest world champion in history, Gukesh returns after a strong 2025 showing and a memorable win over Magnus Carlsen, highlighting India’s growing dominance in world chess.

title: The loss that roared like a win: When India pushed Australia to the edge in Adelaide 1978
content: India's 1977/78 tour of Australia saw a remarkable turnaround. After losing the first two Tests, India secured their maiden wins Down Under, including a stunning series-levelling victory. The decider in Adelaide was a nail-biter, with India pushing Australia to the brink before ultimately losing the series 3-2.

title: Ishan out, Sanju in: India spinner announces playing XI vs USA in T20 World Cup
content: Despite a stellar T20I series, Ishan Kishan was surprisingly omitted from Yuzvendra Chahal's preferred XI for India's T20 World Cup opener. Chahal opted for the struggling Sanju Samson to open alongside Abhishek Sharma, a decision that raises eyebrows given Kishan's dominant recent form.

title: Bhubaneswar court sentences nine Bangladeshis to two years rigorous imprisonment for ‘illegal entry’
content: The Bangladeshi nationals failed to produce a passport, visa or any other valid travel document. They also confessed that they came to India in a clandestine manner

title: Driving Licence suspension recommended for serious traffic violations
content: Traffic violations warranting suspension include over speeding and jumping traffic signals, carrying excess load in goods vehicles or transporting passengers in goods carriages, driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs, and using mobile phones while driving

title: Tamil Nadu gears up for Census  2027; house-listing likely to start after Assembly election
content: Chief Secretary N. Muruganandam chaired the first meeting of the State-level coordination committee at the Secretariat on Monday (February 2, 2026). About 1.5 lakh officials, including enumerators and supervisors, are expected to take part in the exercise in Tamil Nadu

title: Supreme Court grants interim bail to former Chhattisgarh Minister in two liquor scam cases
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant granted the interim relief after considering the fact that Kawasi Lakhma had been in jail since his arrest by ED on January 15 last year on money laundering charges

title: KC(M) bets big on LDF central zone rally, puts to rest defection rumours
content: The Kerala Congress (M) is set to launch its central zone rally from Aranmula on February 6, culminating in Ernakulam on February 14, as it seeks to reinforce its commitment to the Left Democratic Front (LDF). Led by Jose K. Mani, the rally will traverse key towns in Central Kerala, showcasing the party’s strategic importance in the region while seeking to solidify support among coastal Christian communities.

title: Will back any motion by Opposition to impeach Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar: Mamata Banerjee
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister, surrounded by SIR-affected families, addressed a press conference in Delhi on Tuesday a day after she led a delegation to meet EC and later accused the CEC of insulting the delegation.

title: 613 contract employees regularised as casual staff at KMML
content: Land Acquired Persons Association (LAPA) workers currently employed in TSP unit will be upgraded to Direct Contract Workers.  Practice of hiring workers through LAPA will be stopped

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet hands over TTD ghee adulteration case to Commission of Enquiry
content: Commission asked to examine gaps in SIT report, tender changes and procurement lapses to identify masterminds behind the alleged adulteration

title: Amit Shah praises speech made by Sadanandan Master in Rajya Sabha
content: Union Home Minister highlights his party colleague’s remarks on ‘inhuman suffering and atrocities’ endured by BJP and RSS workers in Kerala

title: 84.5% of 1.52 lakh waste-pickers profiled so far come from SC, ST, and OBC communities
content: State-level data show Delhi, Goa, and West Bengal are outliers, where waste-pickers from the General category constitute a majority. Overall, 10.7% workers are from the General category.  The data also showed that 7,402 workers were from ‘Other’ communities.

title: 20% increase in basic salary for cashew workers
content: In factories run by KSCDC and CAPEX, new salary revision will be effective from the date the previously sanctioned interim relief began

title: Court slams delay in filing chargesheet in case alleging attempt to attack Pinarayi Vijayan on board flight
content: The incident occurred on June 13, 2022, during a flight from Kannur to Thiruvananthapuram, when Youth Congress activists staged a protest against the Chief Minister inside the aircraft

title: Health projects worth ₹1,800 crore to be launched in Kerala
content: Chief Minister to lay the foundation for Institute of Organ Transplantation. The institute has been envisaged as a Centre of Excellence, with focus on advanced treatment, research and training in organ transplantation

title: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind moves SC against Assam CM over remarks on Miya Muslims
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma is said to have made allegedly offensive remarks asking for harassing Miya Muslims of Assam in various ways, including asking them to ‘cast their vote in Bangladesh, not India’

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. vows strict action over adulterated ghee in TTD prasadam
content: Cabinet cites grave lapses in procurement since 2019, names senior officials, orders legal action and institutional reforms to protect devotees’ faith and temple sanctity

title: Manikanth Rathod’s Facebook video on reservation triggers widespread criticism
content: In the last Assembly elections, Rathod contested on BJP ticket from Chittapur Constituency reserved for Scheduled Castes

title: YSRCP alleges false narratives on Tirumala laddu issue
content: The Supreme Court-directed SIT has confirmed the purity of the laddu, claims Tirupati MP Gurumoorthy; as per NDDB and NDRI reports, no animal fat has been used, says former Minister

title: In Rajya Sabha, TDP MP seeks clarity on India-U.S. trade deal
content: Opposition protests after saying the deal was first announced by Washington; TDP also flags lack of formal U.S. notification on punitive duty withdrawal

title: Violence erupts during Yuva Morcha march to Kerala Assembly over Sabarimala gold theft issue
content: Police use water cannons multiple times to disperse protesters after they attempt to breach the barricades erected near the Assembly complex

title: Blot on democracy: Rahul Gandhi lodges protest with Lok Sabha Speaker for not being allowed to speak
content: In his letter to Om Birla, the Congress leader noted that while speaking on the Motion on the President's address on February 2, the Speaker had directed him to authenticate a magazine which he intended to refer to while raising the India-China conflict of 2020

title: Cabinet subcommittee tasked with studying PM SHRI in Kerala yet to meet
content: The committee was formed last year after the State government put the implementation of the scheme on hold following opposition from the Communist Party of India (CPI).

title: What we're hearing before the NBA trade deadline: Latest intel on Harden, Giannis, AD and interested teams
content: With just two days until the deadline, which players and teams are Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst watching?

title: Sources: Kraft not selected for HOF Class of 2026
content: Patriots owner Robert Kraft, like his former head coach Bill Belichick, was not selected for entry into this year's Pro Football Hall of Fame class, sources told ESPN.

title: Vonn (ACL) 'confident' she'll compete at Olympics
content: American skier Lindsey Vonn is "confident" she'll race at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics despite suffering ACL and meniscus injuries to her left knee in a crash four days ago.

title: Clippers, Harden exploring trade, sources say
content: The LA Clippers and James Harden are exploring trades ahead of Thursday's deadline, with the Cavaliers one of the teams expressing interest.

title: Sources: Bucks countering trade offers for Giannis
content: The Bucks have submitted counteroffers to teams aggressively seeking a trade for two-time MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Pistons' Duren joins dunk contest field
content: Pistons center Jalen Duren, a first-time All-Star, will participate in the NBA slam dunk contest at All-Star Weekend in Los Angeles, sources told ESPN.

title: NFL to reevaluate Rooney Rule: 'More work to do'
content: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday that the league will take a closer a look at the Rooney Rule and all that it encompasses after an offseason hiring cycle that saw only one of 10 head-coaching jobs go to a minority candidate.

title: Melo IG post hints at frustration with Cuse hoops
content: Syracuse alum Carmelo Anthony does not appear happy with the current state of the program, commenting "SMFH" under a highlight from Monday's loss to UNC.

title: 🏈 James Franklin's rapid recruiting overhaul at VT
content: In a sprint to the early signing period, Franklin gutted his former school and brought life to the Hokies.

title: A do-over of the 2025 NFL draft: Let's redraft the first 64 picks, with changes starting at No. 2
content: Abdul Carter to the Jets? Tyler Shough to the Browns? Emeka Egbuka to the 49ers? We repicked the first two rounds of last year's NFL draft.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Locks, long shots and teams on the edge
content: How are your team's chances to make the Big Dance shaping up in the final six weeks until Selection Sunday?

title: Bracketology: The hottest team in America is Illinois
content: The Fighting Illini are the top 2-seed -- with plenty of time this season to move further up the board.

title: Bracketology: Out of projected field in December, Duke now back in top 16
content: The Blue Devils, up one line to a No. 4 seed, have won 13 straight games and sit atop the ACC with Louisville.

title: The art of the pregame outfit and the stylist behind the NFL's crossover with fashion
content: From pregame style to fashion week, NFL fashion editor Kyle Smith helps players level up their style.

title: Hispanic icons who owned Super Bowl halftime before Bad Bunny
content: From Bruno Mars to Gloria Estefan, a wide array of superstars has graced the Super Bowl halftime stage.

title: Sweets, socks, shoes: The superstitions behind the unbeaten run for Miami (Ohio)
content: Lucky game-day socks. Unlucky shoes from bad games. Here's a look inside the RedHawks' quest for perfection.

title: Premier League desperation rankings: Judging all 20 teams by transfer panic
content: The winter transfer window: when teams make desperation moves to save their season. Which Premier League teams were most desperate this time?

title: Why Liverpool's January transfer window makes no sense
content: Liverpool's lack of defensive depth has been an issue since last summer. Why didn't they improve it in January?

title: Super Bowl LX Patriots-Seahawks media day: Top quotes, moments, highlights
content: Before the Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots take the field for Super Bowl LX, media day festivities took place on Monday.

title: From seeing ghosts to the Super Bowl: Why the Jets' former GM believed in Sam Darnold
content: Mike Maccagnan and former teammates of Darnold talked openly  about their unwavering faith in the QB.

title: Projecting the Super Bowl: Box score, final score and the player prop bets to make
content: Projected final score and box score for the Super Bowl as well as over 100 Super Bowl props arranged in five value tiers.

title: What makes Abbey Murphy one of the most exciting players in women's hockey
content: The USA and Minnesota star's game features highlight-reel assists and goals, penalties and physical play.

title: Stevenson claims No. 1 spot in new division
content: Shakur Stevenson is the top-ranked fighter in two divisions following a dominant win over Teofimo Lopez Jr. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Five stars to trade for or trade away
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Michael Porter Jr. are three of the most commonly traded players right now in ESPN fantasy. If you deal them, here's who you should get in return -- and who you should avoid.

title: Is it time to talk about Guardiola at Man City? Plus: Real Madrid booed, more
content: Are we approaching the end of the Pep Guardiola era at Man City? Plus: Man United grab another win and Real Madrid get booed heavily at home, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest of 2026
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Elena Rybakina are the newly crowned Australian Open champions. Who will win the rest of the majors? We make predictions.

title: Stick with Carrick or hire another coach? Man United must decide
content: the "caretaker" is starting to back the club into a corner . the club have a window in which to decide who, why and when in terms of identifying and hiring their No. 1 candidate as permanent head coach . carrick is closing that window a little too quickly and it might lead to the club having to make a crucial decision sooner than it wants to make it .

title: Shaun White's next act? Revolutionizing snowboarding (again)
content: SHAUN WHITE, 39, has seen himself in a snowboard bib since he last competed at the 2022 Beijing winter Olympics . he will take a ceremonial run through the Buttermilk Mountain halfpipe to open the March 2025 contest that has brought him to town .

title: Panthers reveal custom 'Vamos Gatos' uniforms designed by Jonathan 'Rekal' Torres
content: "Vamos Gatos! Night" is the Panthers' annual celebration of the Hispanic community in south Florida . the 2025-26 jerseys, dropping on Monday, are the most intricate and intricate ones yet . this year's jerseys were designed by the very talented Rekal! graphic artist .

title: TGL highlights: Tiger Woods-less Jupiter Links upsets Atlanta Drive
content: tee shot on the first hole lands in the bunker and Max Homa's goes into the water as their team falls down 1-0 early . the team beat Atlanta 8-6, ending a losing streak that extended to January 2025 . Chris Gotterup sets the longest drive record at 374 yds .

title: State of MLB: Has the Dodgers' dominance propelled the NL past the AL?
content: the national league was founded in 1876 by the Chicago White Stockings officer . it was a loose affiliation of clubs that had problems with competitive balance . in 1901, the American League declared itself a competitor to the NL, jumping up from its minor league status .

title: An epic Rookie of the Year race? This October's Trey Yesavage? 2026 predictions for MLB's top prospects
content: Kiley McDaniel has ranked the best prospects and farm systems in baseball ahead of the 2026 MLB season . the list includes Caden Scarborough, who will be a fixture in the Tigers' every-day lineup by the end of the season.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: LSU moves into top five
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the AP top 25 is out of the top five . ahead of Strong is Maya Moore with 11 and Breanna Stewart with 13 . UCLA becomes the seventh Big Ten tally .

title: Projecting Rounds 1-2 of the draft: Landing spots for 11 Senior Bowl standouts
content: a mock draft of 2026 draft starts April 23 in Pittsburgh . more than 100 prospects from the Senior Bowl will join hundreds of others at the combine . the draft will shuffle draft boards, and free agency next month will alter needs of each team .

title: Man murdered at Vijayawada railway station

title: 'Washington Needs Delhi As A Friend': US-India Forum Head On Trade Deal
content: In a significant breakthrough after months of tense negotiations and public sparring, Washington and New Delhi have sealed a trade deal that slashes US tariffs on Indian goods from 50 per cent to 18 per cent.

title: Video: India Carries Out Test Of Key Ramjet Missile Tech, Joins Elite League
content: The DRDO on Tuesday carried out a successful flight test of solid fuel ducted ramjet (SFDR) technology, placing India into an elite league of nations possessing this technology that enables developing long-range air-to-air missiles, officials said.

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Day 2 Highlights: Amid Chaos In Lok Sabha, Proceedings Adjourned Till 11:00 AM Tomorrow
content: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Day 2 Highlights: The Lower House of the Parliament on Tuesday was adjourned till 11:00 am tomorrow following continuous sloganeering by the Opposition MPs during the Question Hour.

title: France Summons Musk To "Voluntary Interview", Raids X Offices
content: France summoned billionaire Elon Musk to a "voluntary interview" as cybercrime authorities on Tuesday searched the French offices of his social media network X, the Paris public prosecutor's office said.

title: On Backlog In Courts, Chief Justice's "Two Types Of Judges" Remark
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant has expressed concerns over what he pointed out was the tendency of some high court judges who, after reserving a case, don't deliver judgment for a long period of time.

title: "Hold Culprits Accountable": India Slams Theft Of Gandhi Statue In Australia
content: India responded to a bronze statue of Mahatma Gandhi being stolen from Australia's Melbourne. Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said that India has raised the matter with Australian authorities.

title: "Blot On Democracy": Rahul Gandhi Writes To Speaker After Ruckus In Parliament
content: Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi has written to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, suggesting that he was deliberately stopped from speaking in response to President's address, and called it a "blot on democracy".

title: Air Alert Warning Of Russian Attack Sounded In Kyiv During NATO Chief's Visit
content: An air alert warning of a possible Russian missile attack blared out across Kyiv on Tuesday during a visit by NATO chief Mark Rutte.

title: Lawyers Thrash Man Accused Of Raping, Blackmailing Minor Schoolgirl
content: Lawyers and outraged onlookers beat up a 19-year-old accused of raping and blackmailing an innocent 11th-grade student, turning a routine court appearance into a wild brawl right inside the premises of Bhopal's district court.

title: 'When Visitors Turn Judges': Bhagwant Mann On Akali Dal, Dera Chiefs' Jail Meet
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has taken a sharp swipe at Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia and the head of Dera Radha Soami Satsang Beas, Baba Gurinder Singh Dhillon, over their jail meeting.

title: On Grounded Dreamliner's Fuel Switches, Aviation Ministry Cites Air India Inspections
content: The Centre said that inspections of the fuel control switches on a grounded Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner have found both switches "satisfactory", following a pilot's report that a switch did not remain properly latched in the 'RUN' position.

title: Yumnam Khemchand Set To Be Manipur Chief Minister After President's Rule Ends
content: Manipur MLA Yumnam Khemchand Singh has been elected Leader of the BJP Legislature Party, paving the way for the formation of a government headed by him in the border state where the President's Rule will complete a year on February 13.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'Women Unfit For Leadership': Why Bangladesh Jamaat's Words Must Raise Alarm
content: In a recent interview with Al Jazeera, Jamaat-e-Islami chief Dr Shafiqur Rahman said, "On the question of women, Jamaat's position is neither confused nor apologetic - it is principled. We do not think women should come into leadership."

title: Arunachal Cop Mauled To Death By Tiger While Riding Bike
content: A police constable was mauled to death by a tiger while riding his motorcycle in Arunachal Pradesh's Lower Dibang Valley district on Monday.

title: 3 Killed, 10 Injured As Bus Falls In Deep Gorge In Uttarakhand: Cops
content: Three passengers, including two women, were killed and at least 10 others were seriously injured when a Himachal Roadways bus fell into a deep gorge in Uttarakhand's Dehradun district on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Detained For Instigating People In Border Area: Centre
content: The Centre and the Union Territory of Ladakh administration told the Supreme Court on Tuesday that climate activist Sonam Wangchuk was detained for instigating people in a border area where regional sensitivity is involved.

title: Adani Ports' Q3 Profit Rises 21% To Rs 3,043 Crore, Revenue Jumps 22%
content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited (APSEZ) on Tuesday reported strong financial performance for the December quarter (Q3 FY26), with consolidated net profit rising 21 per cent year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 3,043 crore.

title: Consulting With Parties On Impeaching Poll Body Chief Over SIR: Trinamool
content: The Trinamool Congress will speak to other parties to discuss the possibility of making a move to impeach Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, party MP Kalyan Banerjee told reporters today.

title: Adani Enterprises' Net Profit Surges 90 Times To Rs 5,627 Crore In Q3
content: Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL), the flagship company of the Adani Group, on Tuesday registered an impressive 90 times growth in net profit at Rs 5,627 crore for the October-December quarter (Q3 FY26) year-on-year.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Benoît Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More
